From the wild. What is the method of getting more from this exception?

@jskeet ..any update on this issue. I am using grpc.core 1.7.1 and facing same issue while accessing google pub sub.

Status(StatusCode=Unauthenticated, Detail="Getting metadata from plugin failed with error: Exception occured in metadata credentials plugin.")

@aparoha: If you're using Grpc.Core 1.7.1 that would suggest you're using an old version of the PubSub library too. I would *at least* recommend updating to a new version of Google.Cloud.PubSub.V1, which will pull in a newer version of Grpc.Core - and a newer version of Google.Apis.Auth. We've made some changes that *may* help avoid the problem happening, but this issue is more about how useful the diagnostics are when it *does* happen - and that's something I don't know as much about as it's in the gRPC library rather than one of the libraries I maintain.

I'm getting the same. Currently building a new API that uses Firestore as the backend and it fails when performing this call when using `Google.Cloud.Firestore` v1.0.0beta-06:

```c#
public async Task<T> FindOneByFieldAsync(string fieldPath, object value, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default(CancellationToken))
{
    // This fails:
    var query = await MyCollectionReference
        .WhereEqualTo(fieldPath, value)
        .GetSnapshotAsync(cancellationToken);

    var document = query.Documents.FirstOrDefault();
    return document?.ConvertTo<T>();
}
```

I know it worked some time last week but I'm not sure which version it was back then.
